abstract.p: Aug 8 article about efforts by Charles Schwab to champion term 'learning difference' over 'learning disability' referred incorrectly to his actions and those of Schwab Foundation for Learning

block.p: An article on Tuesday about efforts by the financier Charles Schwab to champion the term ''learning difference'' over ''learning disability'' referred incorrectly to his actions and those of his Schwab Foundation for Learning. While Mr. Schwab has pledged substantial financial support to an organization that uses the term ''learning difference,'' he is not spending the equivalent of hundreds of millions of dollars on such a campaign. His foundation, with an endowment of $280 million, embraces both terms.
